result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Pancheri was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with Ct.11 but Consecutive to Ct.5.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $15,597.00 plus surcharges; jointly & severally with Paul Lansdown.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations or disruptive groups  May not have contact with Eden Contreras-Garcia, Ruben Huerta-Gonzalez, or Osvaldo Rivera, their residences, or their families.  No Contact with PJ's Cabin Fever, Rat Race, Sam's Amusement, and Stan's Place.  Not to associate with anyone who uses or traffics in illegal substances.

records.addlTxt:
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michael Barth.  Victim rights compliance.  No corrections or additions to the PSI.  Deft stipulates to restitution in the amount of $15,597.00; jointly and severally with co-deft Paul Lansdown.  Sentencing arguments made.  

Count 5 - deft sentenced to 5yrs WSP; initial confinement of 2yrs followed by 3yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Credit for 464 days.  Deft eligible for CIP and SAP.

Counts 1 & 11 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 4yrs on each count concurrent but consecutive to count 5.  Probation conditions to be identical to those of ES.    

Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Bond from 14CM807 to be applied towards financial obligations
from Tina Saulys with attached photos
for Substitution of Attorneys.  Atty Michael Barth is substituted as attorney for def. in place of Atty Dirk Jensen.
from Jaclyn Saulys
Fax Trasnmittal
Order for Pre-Sentence Investigation

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Dirk Jensen.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  Counts 1, 5 and 11 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2 thru 4, 6 thru 10 and 12 thru 17 are Dismissed and Read In.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on December 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Dirk Jensen.  Clerk: PT
Atty Binger states he relayed an offer to Atty Jensen and Atty Jensen hopes to have a resolution by the end of next week.  Case will remain on for trial unless resolved.

14CF1030 / 14CM807
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Dirk Jensen.  Clerk: PT
Case is not resolved at this time and Atty Jensen withdraws his motion to sever and requests another status date along with a trial date.  14CM807 will trail 14CF1030.  Upon hearing statements made by parties.  Status Conf. on 9/11/15 at 9:00 AM; Jury Trial on 10/19/15 at 8:30 AM.  Parties advised there will not be a jury status so they need to submit a letter or email to the court on 10/15/15 regarding the status of their case.
9/12/14 - Preliminary Hearing (Sent to Br. 8 for 6/23 hearing)
State's Response to Deft's Motion to Sever -filed by ADA, Thomas Binger  kmk
09-12-14 Preliminary Hearing
Defendant's Motion to Sever Defendants in 14CF1030 & 15CF70 filed by Atty Jensen
Defendant's Notice of Motion for Severance filed by Atty Jensen

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Dirk Jensen.  Clerk: PT
Atty Jensen states he is still waiting for discovery from the State re: DVDs & photos so case is not resolved at this time.  Atty Binger states he will file a formal motion to consolidate for trial and Atty Jensen states he will be filing a motion to sever.  Atty Jensen to file his motion by 5/29 and State to respond 5 days before the next hearing.  Motion Hearing on 6/23/15 at 10:0 AM as Co-Defendant in 14CM807 is already scheduled at that time.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Dirk Jensen.  Clerk: PT
Atty Jensen was just appointed 48 hours ago in place of Atty Walker and requests an adjournment as he hasnt seen the criminal complaint yet and needs to obtain discovery; no objection by the State.  Status Conf. on 5/14/15 at 9:45 AM.
atty D Jensen

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jeremy Chavez specially for Attorney Laura Walker.  Clerk: PT
Atty Chavez states Atty Walker resides in Colorado unable to catch a flight for today.  Court sets case over with co-deft. case on 4/2/15 9:50 AM.
Laura Walker  kmk
Permitting Withdrawal of Attorney Ward

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney John Ward.  Clerk: PT
Upon hearing statements court grants Atty Ward's motion to withdraw.  Atty Ward to contact PD's Office to have another attorney appointed.  Atty Ward states DE has new charges pending in 15CF70, which is scheduled for an initial hearing on 2/12/15.  Court cancels March trial at this time.  Status Conf. on 3/31/15 at 9:40 AM.
Motion to Withdraw scheduled 2/4/15 at 10:20 AM per confirmation from Atty Ward
Court has reviewed Atty Ward's request to withdraw and hearing to be scheduled.
Stipulation & Order forwarded to the judge for approval.
and Demand for Discovery filed by ADA Binger

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney John Ward.  Clerk: PT
Deft. is rejecting State's offer and Ludwig Hearing held.  This case is not resolved and file 14CM807 will trail this file.  Jury Status on 3/5/15 at 1:00 PM.  Jury Trial on 3/9/15 at 8:30 AM.
Scheduling Order

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. John Ward. Clerk LE. KPD Det. Eric Traxler sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Ward. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 10-9-14 @ 1:15pm with 14CM807. Bond continued.

140 p.m.  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Ward.  Clk: NJurgens.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Comm Mason on  9/12/14 @ 10 a.m. Bond - continued.

*No Contact w/Paul L, Pamela S, Patrick M, Bruce D, Alissa S, Eden C-G, Ruben H-G, Osvaldo M-R, Alicia N, Michelle T, Samantha T, Cathy L, or their residences, PJ's Cabin Fever, and Mikki's Rat Race.
